Content.Name: Play Recommendations
Content.Title: Play Recommendations
Content.BodyCopy:
DEPARTMENT READING LIST

We recommend that all students be familiar with the following plays for general discussion in theatre classes. Students are encouraged to use their time reading and becoming familiar with these playwrights and specific play titles. The list is not exhaustive; we encourage students to read broadly.

Sophocles
 
Euripedes

Antigone

Oedipus Rex

Medea
Plautus
Terence

The Menaechmi

The Self-Tormentor
Medieval

Everyman

The Woman Taken in Adultery

The Second Shepherd's Play
Moliere

The Misanthrope

Tartuffe
Racine

Phaedra
Shakespeare

Hamlet

King Lear

Othello

A Midsummer Night's Dream
Lope de Vega

Fuente Ovejuna
Calderon de le Barca

Life is a Dream
Richard Brinsley Sheridan

The School for Scandal
Oliver Goldsmith

She Stoops to Conquer
Henrik Ibsen

A Doll's House

Hedda Gabler

Ghosts
Anton Chekhov

The Cherry Orchard

Uncle Vanya

The Three Sisters
G.B. Shaw

Pygmalion

Major Barbara
Thornton Wilder

The Skin of Our Teeth

Our Town
Eugene O'Neill

Long Day's Journey Into Night

Hairy Ape

Ah, Wilderness!
Lillian Hellman

Little Foxes
Tennessee Williams

A Streetcar Named Desire

The Glass Menagerie
Arthur Miller

Death of a Salesman

The Crucible
Neil Simon
 

Barefoot in the Park

The Odd Couple
Loraine Hansbury

Raisin in the Sun
Marsha Norman

'night Mother
August Wilson

The Piano Lesson

Fences
Beth Henley

Crimes of the Heart
William Nicholson

Shadowlands
Robert Bolt

A Man For All Seasons
Harold Pinter

The Caretaker
Edward Albee

Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?
Bertholt Brecht

The Good Woman of Setzuan

The Caucasian Chalk Circle
